item.title: Nintendo switch / KORG music game
item.dc:creator: moemx
item.description:
I totally get you thereâ€¦ been luckily playing around with Ableton A LOT lately, which kinda helps to understand the KORG UI a little better. But still, usability wise Auxy offers a way more playful and if anything easy workflow I like much more. Okay. wonâ€™t invest in Gadget until I know what tomorrow is gonna present ! psyched.

item.title: Nintendo switch / KORG music game
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yeah if I wasnâ€™t using Auxy, Iâ€™d probably just suck up my total disgust with the sequencer for Gadget and be using that. I really, really, really hate the sequencer. Editing automation is wonky, the whole clip paradigm would be cool if you could mix and match clips like Live, buuuuuutâ€¦ you canâ€™t. So I donâ€™t really GET it lol.

With that said, the effects, the sounds, the synths, the audio mangling options are so, so slick. Iâ€™ve easily spent upwards of a hundred bucks on the whole ecosystem and I never use it lol but itâ€™s definitely good for those who can deal with (or gasp LIKE) the sequencer

item.title: Nintendo switch / KORG music game
item.dc:creator: moemx
item.description:
But even for the limited version (which only allows for 3 synths) I like the variety of effects, you got a modular system covered thatâ€™s a lot of fun to play around with!

So much fun. Then again: 3 is not enough for a decently arranged track. On another topic: Auxy hurry up with that update!! I need stuff to play around with!

item.title: Nintendo switch / KORG music game
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Was gonna post before but @blakkaz covered it. Long story short, Iâ€™d imagine your input/output options would be limited on the Switch version. The iOS version is pretty cool, I canâ€™t get on with the sequencer at all but the sound is pretty great.

Nowadays I just use it to knock together loops to ingest somewhere else. It probably doesnâ€™t help Iâ€™m using it on the smallest screen possible (iPhone SE), if I was using an iPad I suspect Iâ€™d probably use it more often.
